Notation Definition

k𝑘k Index of IoT device

𝐱k​isubscript𝐱𝑘𝑖\mathbf{x}_{ki} Input of the FL model
yk​isubscript𝑦𝑘𝑖y_{ki} Output of the FL model

fksubscript𝑓𝑘f_{k} CPU frequency of IoT device k𝑘k

Et,k​1c​m​psuperscriptsubscript𝐸𝑡𝑘1𝑐𝑚𝑝E_{t,k1}^{cmp} Energy consumption for computing ck​Dt,ksubscript𝑐𝑘subscript𝐷𝑡𝑘c_{k}D_{t,k} CPU cycles
Et,kc​m​psuperscriptsubscript𝐸𝑡𝑘𝑐𝑚𝑝E_{t,k}^{cmp} Total computation energy at IoT device k𝑘k
rt,ku​psuperscriptsubscript𝑟𝑡𝑘𝑢𝑝r_{t,k}^{up} Achievable uplink transmit rate
bt.ksubscript𝑏formulae-sequence𝑡𝑘b_{t.k} Bandwidth allocated to IoT device k𝑘k by the server

𝔖dsubscript𝔖𝑑\mathfrak{S}_{d} Size of the global model

references: In this section, we study the training protocol and energy model of FL. The notations used in the paper are summarized in Table I.

S6.T2.caption: TABLE II: Simulation parameters
S6.T2.table:
Parameters Values
Number of rounds (T𝑇T) 1000
Number of local iterations (L𝐿L) 4
For training one data sample CPU cycles per bit (cksubscript𝑐𝑘c_{k}) 20 cycles / bit
Computation capacity of IoT device k𝑘k (fksubscript𝑓𝑘f_{k}) [2, 4] GHZ
Transmit power of IoT device k𝑘k (Pt,k)P_{t,k}) [0.1, 60] W
Transmit power of the edge server (Ptssuperscriptsubscript𝑃𝑡𝑠P_{t}^{s}) [100,1000] W
Uplink channel gain (Gt,ksubscript𝐺𝑡𝑘G_{t,k} ) [10−3,10−1]superscript103superscript101[10^{-3},10^{-1}] dB
Downlink channel gain (Ht,ksubscript𝐻𝑡𝑘H_{t,k} ) [10−1,10]superscript10110[10^{-1},10] dB
Power spectral density of the Gaussian noise (N0subscript𝑁0N_{0}) 1.0×10−81.0superscript1081.0\times 10^{-8}
Parameter size of the global model (Sdsubscript𝑆𝑑S_{d}) 1×1041superscript1041\times 10^{4} bit
Upload data size of IoT device (𝔖usubscript𝔖𝑢\mathfrak{S}_{u}) 5×1045superscript1045\times 10^{4} bit
Binary indicator of device selection (βt,ksubscript𝛽𝑡𝑘\beta_{t,k} ) {0, 1}
System parameter (μksubscript𝜇𝑘\mu_{k}) 4.2×10−94.2superscript1094.2\times 10^{-9}
Effective capacitance coefficient (ϵksubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑘\epsilon_{k}) 1.2×10−281.2superscript10281.2\times 10^{-28}
The amount of harvested energy (Δ​Et,kΔsubscript𝐸𝑡𝑘\Delta E_{t,k}) [50, 200] J
The constant value (ν𝜈\nu) 1.0
Critic network learning rate 3×10−43superscript1043\times 10^{-4}
Policy network learning rate 3×10−43superscript1043\times 10^{-4}
Neural network weight coefficient (ϕitalic-ϕ\phi) 5×10−35superscript1035\times 10^{-3}
Interval of policy target network update (d𝑑d) 10
Discount factor (γ𝛾\gamma) 0.99
Batch size (N𝑁N) 45
Replay buffer size (|ℬ|ℬ|\mathcal{B}|) 5×1055superscript1055\times 10^{5}
Exploration noise (σ𝜎\sigma) 0.50.50.5
Clipped normal noise (c𝑐c) 0.50.50.5
references:
In this section, we present the implementation of the proposed
FL-DLT3 on PyTorch, which is an open source machine learning library based on the Torch library. We compare FL-DLT3 with benchmarks in terms of network size, data size, and communication bandwidth. Table II specifies the configuration of simulation parameters.
